message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I'm sure you'll love. I'm willing to let it go for $200. It's a steal at this price, if I do say so myself!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Can you meet me there?

I understand you're interested in the product, but I'm not quite ready to meet you at $120. I'm willing to compromise and offer it to you for $170. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll find it's worth every penny!
I'm still interested in the product, but I'd like to meet you in the middle at $150. Can you consider that?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob! However, I'm not quite ready to meet you at $150. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer: $160. It's the lowest I'm willing to go, and I think it's still a great deal for both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $130. Can you consider that?
I'm not quite ready to meet you at $130, Bob. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer: $155. It's the best I can do, and I think it's still a great deal for both of us.
I'm really interested in the product, but I'm not willing to go any higher than $140. Can you meet me there?

I understand you're close to making a decision, Bob. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer: $145. It's my final offer, and I think it's a great compromise. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm really close to walking away, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $125. If not, I'll have to look elsewhere.
